definition[0]: to become too hot, or to make something too hot
example[0]: I think the engine’s overheating again.
example[1]: Try not to overheat the sauce.
definition[1]: if a country’s economy overheats, or if something overheats it, it grows too fast and this leads to increases in prices, salaries, interest rates etc
definition[2]: if an economy overheats, demand rises too fast, causing prices and imports to rise, a situation that governments may try to correct by raising taxes and interest rates
example[2]: Lifting economies out of recession is easy compared with deciding when to re-apply the brakes so the economy does not overheat later.
example[3]: Germany overheated its economy as it poured money into rebuilding the East.
